level.heading: Pleading.
level.text: In a derivative action to enforce a right of a limited cooperative association, the complaint shall state:
The date and content of the plaintiff's demand under § 29-1013.01(1) and the association's response;
If 90 days have not expired since the demand, how irreparable harm to the association would result by waiting for the expiration of 90 days;
If the association agreed to bring an action demanded, that the action has not been brought within a reasonable time; and
If the demand should be excused as futile, the reasons therefor.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 added (4) and made related changes.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 1303 of the Uniform Limited Cooperative Association Act.
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
